SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AnotherClientRMITimeoutException
AnotherClientRMITimeoutException extends ClientRMITimeoutException, is thrown if client RMI has disconnected during setup situations
App
App class is the MyShelfie main class that allow the user to start the game as client (via GUI or CLI) or as server See AppServer and MyShelfieAppClient documentations for more information.
AppClient
The AppClient class represents the player as a user in a client/server application pattern.
AppClient.UIType
The UIType represents the type of UI implemented in MyShelfie: CLI - Command Line Interface GUI - Graphical User Interface
AppClientRMI
The AppClientRMI class represents a specific type of AppClient class used for the RMI connection type.
AppClientSocket
The AppClientSocket class represents a specific type of AppClient class used for the Socket connection type.
AppServer
The AppServer interface is the representation of the Server computer that manages all the matches.
AppServer.typeOfMatch
Enumeration for the type of match: - an unfinished match - a new two players game - a new three players game - a new four players game
AppServerImpl
The AppServerImpl is the implementation of AppServer interface.
Bag
This class represent the bag of the game.
BagTest
Class BagTest tests Bag class
Category
Class Category is an enumeration containing the name of the item figures.
ChoicesMenuController
The ChoicesMenuController class implements the GUIController and Initializable interfaces.
Client
The Client class represents an Interface for ClientImpl, ClientSkeleton and MathLog classes.
Client.QuitState
The QuitState represent the cause behind a client disconnection: NORMAL stands for a voluntary disconnection EMPTY_BAG stand for a disconnection due to an empty bag QUIT stand for any other type of disconnection
ClientDisconnectionException
Class ClientDisconnectionException is thrown when server doesn't receive messages from client.
ClientImpl
The ClientImpl class is an implementation of the Client Interface.
ClientImpl.ClientState
The ClientState represents the state in which the client could be.
ClientRMITimeoutException
class ClientRMITimeoutException is thrown if client RMI has disconnected during setup situations
ClientSkeleton
The ClientSkeleton class represents a client skeleton that implements the Client interface.
Command
The Command interface represents an implementation of command design pattern.
CommonObjCard
CommonObjCard class represents the common objective cards of the game.
CommonObjCardReader
The CommonObjCardReader class is the JSON reader necessary for commonObjCard creation.
CommonObjCardTest
Class CommonObjCardTest tests CommonObjCard class
CommonObjCardView
The immutable view of CommonObjCard
Controller
This class represent the top of the controller section (the CONTROLLER in MVC).
ControllerTest
Class ControllerTest tests Controller class
CornerDiagonals
A specific CommonObjCard group type (commonObjCardID 11, 8, 12)
CornerDiagonalsTest
Class CornerDiagonalsTest tests CornerDiagonals class
FullColumnException
Class FullColumnException is thrown when the shelf column is full.
Game
Game class represents the main logic of MyShelfie.
GameBoard
GameBoard class represents the game table of the game.
GameBoardTest
Class GameBoardTest tests GameBoard class
GameBoardView
The immutable view of Gameboard
GameTest
Class GameTest tests Game class
GameView
The immutable view of Game
GroupCards
A specific CommonObjCard group type (commonObjCardID 4, 3, 1, 9)
GroupCardsTest
Class GroupCardsTest tests GroupCards class
GUI
The GUI class manages the UX/UI via graphical representation.
GUIController
The GUIController interface defines methods for controlling the graphical user interface (GUI) of an application.
InvalidMatchesException
class InvalidMatchesException is thrown if the number of matches between the item position in the player shelf and in the template grid of the personal object card is more than 6.
InvalidNumberOfPlayersException
Class InvalidNumberOfPlayersException is thrown when number of players entered is less than two or more than four.
InvalidPointerException
Class InvalidPointerException is thrown as NullPointerException.
InvalidSelectionException
Class InvalidSelectionException is thrown when the Items drawn by the player: -are not in the same column or in the same row on the game board; -are not one after the other on the game board; -have not almost a free side on the game board.
Item
Item class represents the object cards of the game.Their positions are important for the conduct of the game.
ItemTest
Class ItemTest tests Item class
MainGameController
The MainGameController class implements the GUIController interface and serves as the controller for the main game screen.
MainMenuController
The MainMenuController class implements the GUIController interface and handles the main menu of the application.
MatchChoicesController
The MatchChoicesController class is responsible for controlling the match choices window in the GUI.
MatchLog
The MatchLog contains various methods to keep track and update statistics about a running match (connection/disconnections, choices made by the players, etc.) and display them on the server
ModelSubject
The ModelSubject class is used as a means to send notifications with information about the state of a game (connections/disconnections, choices made, objectives reached, etc.).
MyShelfieAppClient
The MyShelfieAppClient class represents the first class of MyShelfie client section.
NoConsecutiveSelectionException
class NoConsecutiveSelectionException is thrown when two non-consecutive items are drawn from the game board.
NoElementException
Class NoElementException is thrown as NoSuchElementException.
NoFreeSidesException
Class NoFreeSidesException is thrown when the item selected from the game board has no free sides.
NoMatchException
Class NoMatchException is thrown when there aren't existing matches to join.
NoMoreHeartbeatException
NoMoreHeartbeatException extends ClientRMITimeoutException, is thrown if client RMI has disconnected during setup situations
NotMessageFromServerYet
Class NotMessageFromClientYet is thrown when client doesn't receive messages from server.
NotSameRowOrColException
Class NotSameRowOrColException is thrown when the selected items aren't from the same row or column:
NotSupportedMatchesException
class NotSupportedMatchesException is thrown when there is an unsupported number of matches.
ObjectivesController
The ObjectivesController class implements the GUIController interface and controls the objective cards' window in the application.
OutOfBoundsException
Class OutOfBoundsException is thrown as ArrayOutOfBoundsException.
PersonalCardReader
This class is a representation of a JSON reader.
PersonalObjCard
This class is a representation of the PersonalObjCard entity.
PersonalObjCardReaderTest
Class PersonalObjCardReaderTest tests PersonalObjCardReader class
PersonalObjCardTest
Class PersonalObjCardTest tests PersonalObjCard class
PersonalObjCardView
The immutable view of PersonalObjCard
Player
Player class represents the players of the game.
PlayersShelfController
This class represents a controller for the players' shelf in a GUI application.
PlayerTest
Class PlayerTest tests Player class
PlayerView
The immutable view of Player
RMIClientDisconnectionException
Class RMIClientDisconnectionException is thrown as RemoteException.
RowsColumnsCard
A specific CommonObjCard group type (commonObjCardID 6, 2)
RowsColumnsCardTest
Class RowsColumnsCardTest tests RowsColumnsCard class
SelectColumnCommand
The SelectColumnCommand class represents a command for selecting a column of the player's shelf where the selected items will be placed
SelectionInvalidOrEmptySlotException
Class SelectionInvalidOrEmptySlotException is thrown when items selected from the game board are taken from empty or invalid slot.
SelectItemsCommand
The SelectItemsCommand class represents a command for picking tiles from the game board.
SelectOrderCommand
The SelectOrderCommand class represents a command for sorting the selected tiles in order to put them into the player's shelf following the right order desired by the player
Server
The Server class represents an Interface for ServerImpl and ServerStub classes.
ServerImpl
The ServerImpl class is an implementation of Server interface.
ServerStub
The ServerStub class represents an implementation of the Server Interface.
Shelf
This class represent the shelf of the player.
ShelfTest
Class ShelfTest tests Shelf class
ShelfView
The immutable view of Shelf
StrategyCheck
The StrategyCheck class is the implementation of the strategy design pattern to the CommonObjCard.
TextualUI
The TextualUI class represents a textual user interface for a game.
ThreeDifferentTypes
A specific CommonObjCard group type (commonObjCardID 7,5)
ThreeDifferentTypesTest
Class ThreeDifferentTypesTest tests ThreeDifferentTypes class
TooManyMatchesException
class NotSupportedMatchesException is thrown when the server has too many matches to manage.
TurnChecker
The TurnChecker class is responsible for managing checks about CommonObjectiveCards' goal, the number of adjacent items and possibly the need to refill the game bord which have to be performed before ending a player's turn.
TurnCheckerTest
Class TurnCheckerTest tests TurnChecker class
TurnHandler
The TurnHandler class manages the turns in a game and handles the game flow.
TurnHandlerTest
TurnHandlerTest class tests TurnHandler class.
UI
The UI interface represents the user interface component of the application.
ViewSubject
ViewSubject is an interface implemented in all UI classes, it contains notification update methods about choices made by a player and disconnections
XCards
A specific CommonObjCard group type (commonObjCardID 10)
XCardsTest
Class XCardsTest tests XCards class
